docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Clone the GitHub repository: 
    git clone https://github.com/Kasper-Heliophysics-MDP/draft.git
  2. Move into the project directory: 
    cd draft
  3. Set up a virtual enviroment (to isolate dependencies): 
    python3 -m venv .venv .
  4. Activate the virtual enviroment: 
    . .venv/bin/activate
  5. Install the project and dependencies: 
    pip install -e .
    This installs the project as a package (in "editable" mode), enabling you to import it throughout the codebase while reflecting changes made without needing to reinstall.

docs.title: Updating Documentation
docs.text:
This documentation site is built using MkDocs. MkDocs reads the Markdown (.md) files from the docs/ folder and configures the site according to the settings defined in mkdocs.yml.

  1. Edit Documentation Files: Modify .md files in the docs/ directory.

  2. Preview Changes Locally: To preview your changes, run the following command from the project directory: 

    mkdocs serve
    This command will provide a link to view the current documentation in your web browser.

  3. Build the Static Site: 

    mkdocs build

  4. Deploy the Changes: 

    mkdocs gh-deploy
    This command will build the docs, commit them to the gh-pages branch and push the gh-branch pages branch to GitHub.

docs.title: standardize_rows(arr)
docs.text:
Standardize each row by subtracting the mean and dividing by the standard deviation.

Parameters:

  • arr (ndarray) –

    2D array to standardize.

Returns:

  • –

    np.ndarray: Row-standardized 2D array.

Source code in draft/utils/preprocessing.py 
def standardize_rows(arr):
    """
    Standardize each row by subtracting the mean and dividing by the standard deviation.

    Args:
        arr (np.ndarray): 2D array to standardize.

    Returns:
        np.ndarray: Row-standardized 2D array.
    """
    mean_per_row = np.mean(arr, axis=1, keepdims=True)
    std_per_row = np.std(arr, axis=1, keepdims=True)

    # Prevent divide by 0 errors
    epsilon = 1e-8
    std_per_row = np.maximum(std_per_row, epsilon)

    return (arr - mean_per_row) / std_per_row

docs.title: load_fits_file(fits_file_path, num_freq_chans_to_remove=10)
docs.text:
Load spectrogram from a FITS into a numpy array.

Parameters:

  • fits_file_path (str) –

    Path to .fits file containing the spectrogram data.

  • num_freq_chans_to_remove (int, default: 10 ) –

    Optional parameter to remove low frequency channels with bad signal.

Returns:

  • –

    np.ndarray: Array

Source code in draft/utils/utils.py 
def load_fits_file(fits_file_path, num_freq_chans_to_remove=10):
    """Load spectrogram from a FITS into a numpy array.

    Args:
        fits_file_path (str): Path to .fits file containing the spectrogram data.
        num_freq_chans_to_remove (int): Optional parameter to remove low frequency channels with bad signal.

    Returns:
        np.ndarray: Array 
    """
    fits_full_data = astropy.io.fits.open(fits_file_path)
    fits_array = fits_full_data[0].data[:-num_freq_chans_to_remove,:]
    return fits_array
